}}'''Túrin II''' ([[Third Age]] {{TA|2815|n}}<ref name="Elendil">{{PM|Elendil}}</ref> – {{TA|2914|n}},<ref name="South">{{App|South}}</ref> aged 99 years) was the twenty-third [[Ruling Steward]] of [[Gondor]]. 

==History==
Túrin succeeded his father [[Thorondir]] at his death in {{TA|2882}}.<ref name="South"/> [[Ithilien]] was further deserted because of infestation by [[Orcs of Mordor]]. It was Túrin who built secret refuges for his soldiers in Ithilien, of which [[Henneth Annûn]] was the longest guarded and manned. He also fortified the isle of [[Cair Andros]] to defend [[Anórien]].<ref name="Elendil"/><ref name=stew>{{App|Stewards}}</ref>

During his time also the fief [[South Gondor]] was occupied by the [[Haradrim]] and there was fighting along the river [[Poros]], until in {{TA|2885|n}} they invaded Ithilien was invaded in great strength. His ally King [[Folcwine]] of [[Rohan]] fulfilled the [[Oath of Eorl]] and sent many men to Gondor. With their aid Túrin won a victory at the crossing of the river, though the princes [[Fastred (son of Folcwine)|Fastred]] and [[Folcred]] were slain.<ref name=stew/><ref>{{App|TA}}</ref>

Túrin was followed by his son [[Turgon (Steward of Gondor)|Turgon]] at his death in {{TA|2914|n}}.<ref name="South"/>

==Etymology==
For the meaning of his name refer to [[Túrin#Etymology|Túrin - Etymology]]. Túrin II was probably named after [[Túrin|Túrin Turambar]], a tragic hero of the [[Edain]] of the [[First Age]].<ref>{{NM|P2v}}, footnote 3, p. 189</ref><ref>{{PM|Elendil}}, p. 203</ref>
